results.title: An Interview with Joyce Bryan
results.brief_description: Joyce Bryan was a witness to the return of the Prisoners of War from Japan. She provides an powerful and detailed rendering of the emotionally charged return and the struggles of the men to fit back into society.
results.description: Joyce Bryan was a witness to the return of the Prisoners of War from Japan. She provides an powerful and detailed rendering of the emotionally charged return and the struggles of the men to fit back into society.
description_for_label: Joyce Bryan was a witness to the return of the Prisoners of War from Japan. She provides an powerful and detailed rendering of the emotionally charged return and the struggles of the men to fit back into society.

results.title: An Interview with James Ross Irvine
results.brief_description: James Ross Irvine and his brother were both involved in significant battles in Papua New Guinea in World War II. With a stoic sensibility and grim humour, Irvine relates the story of the last time he saw his brother before he was killed in battle.
results.description: James Ross Irvine and his brother were both involved in significant battles in Papua New Guinea in World War II. With a stoic sensibility and grim humour, Irvine relates the story of the last time he saw his brother before he was killed in battle.

results.title: An Interview with Evelyn Warner
results.brief_description: Evelyn Warner was in London when World War II was declared. As a very young cadet, Warner cycled around the countryside delivering messages. Then one day she had an encounter with a ‘doddlebug’, an unmanned plane designed to crash and burn, that left her red-faced.
results.description: Evelyn Warner was in London when World War II was declared. As a very young cadet, Warner cycled around the countryside delivering messages. Then one day she had an encounter with a ‘doddlebug’, an unmanned plane designed to crash and burn, that left her red-faced.

results.title: Ready and able
results.brief_description: Members of the CFA provide practical advice on how to prepare for and survive a major catastrophe like a bushfire or a flood. These interviews were conducted in light of the tragic Black Saturday bushfires in February 2009.
results.description: Members of the CFA provide practical advice on how to prepare for and survive a major catastrophe like a bushfire or a flood. These interviews were conducted in light of the tragic Black Saturday bushfires in February 2009.

group.title: Living with disaster: stories and experiences from disasters

group_siblings.title: When a fire comes to you

results.title: When a fire comes to you
results.brief_description: When the threat of fire hit Lydia Romari’s family, they adopted their fire plan and stayed safe. Unfortunately, it doesn’t erase the frustration, anxiety and horror of the Black Saturday bushfires that devestated much of the Yarra Ranges region in Victoria in 2009.
results.description: When the threat of fire hit Lydia Romari’s family, they adopted their fire plan and stayed safe. Unfortunately, it doesn’t erase the frustration, anxiety and horror of the Black Saturday bushfires that devestated much of the Yarra Ranges region in Victoria in 2009.

results.title: Home again
results.brief_description: Kat Hay provides her account of the Newcastle Floods of 2007, from the realisation that it was not an ordinary day to the feelings associated with returning home after everything was destroyed.

results.title: When the flood comes
results.brief_description: The Newcastle floods of 2007 have caused Djibril Ly to reflect on growing up in Mauritania in West Africa. He recalls the devestation of flooding and how this has helped him to prepare for similar events in Australia.

results.title: A Plan to be safe
results.brief_description: Carla Zekas and her family were spending a hot Summer’s day by the river when the dark clouds first emerged. At that moment, the plan changed from staying cool to being safe.

results.title: A Dream to create a home
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Wendy Walters and ACMI
results.brief_description: Wendy Walters and her group of passionate people set about building a home for ninety people in Mill Park, Victoria. Through the dreams and idealism is frustration at the struggle to make this building home for so many different people.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Wendy Walters and ACMI
